recrtools 0.1.0

    • Recoding Survey 'Other' Responses

    Recode "Other" responses in a survey column using a dictionary

    recode_by_dict.Rd

    This function handles a standard survey pattern: a primary select one column with an "Other" option, and a free-text column with "other" responses. It applies a dictionary-based recoding for any text responses and standardizes the final output.

    recode_by_dict(select_col, other_col, dict, na_values = c("777", 777, NA))

    Arguments

    select_col

    Character vector. The primary selected option (may include "Other").

    other_col

    Character vector. The free-text responses for "Other" answers.

    dict

    Named list. Dictionary mapping category names to keywords for recoding.

    na_values

    Character or numeric vector. Values that should be treated as NA (default: c("777", 777, NA)).

    Value

    A character vector of recoded responses.

    Examples

    survey <- tibble(
  response_id = 1:5,
  activity_select = c("biking", "hiking", "other", "other", "running"),
  activity_other_text = c(NA, NA, "mountain biking", "trail run", NA)
)
#> Error in tibble(response_id = 1:5, activity_select = c("biking", "hiking",     "other", "other", "running"), activity_other_text = c(NA,     NA, "mountain biking", "trail run", NA)): could not find function "tibble"

dict <- list(
  biking = c("bike", "biking", "cycling"),
  running = c("run", "running", "jog"),
  hiking = c("hike", "walk", "stroll")
)

survey <- survey %>%
  mutate(auto_recode = recode_other(activity_select, activity_other_text, dict))
#> Error in survey %>% mutate(auto_recode = recode_other(activity_select,     activity_other_text, dict)): could not find function "%>%"
